EXP1.TITLE: FullStack Developer
EXP1.DESC_1: Developed multiple modules to automate logistics operations, including trip closures, unit availability, and operator work schedules. Implemented route mapping and tracking functionalities, as well as data capture for the system. Utilized technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, C#, .NET, and SQL Server.

EXP2.TITLE: FullStack Developer
EXP2.DESC_1: Developed and implemented the institution‚Äôs graduate tracking system, optimizing information management through specific operations. This system facilitated the reintegration and connection of alumni with the university community, providing insights into their current status, career paths, and professional performance. Successfully acquired and updated 70% of alumni data using technologies such as HTML, Bootstrap, Ruby on Rails, and PostgreSQL.

EXP3.TITLE: FullStack Developer
EXP3.DESC_1: Collaborated with multidisciplinary and multinational teams following the Scrum methodology, using Git and GitHub for version control in the development of the ‚ÄúGIS Vendor-Tracking‚Äù, ‚ÄúGIS Route-Vendor‚Äù, ‚ÄúGIS Configurations‚Äù and ‚ÄúGIS Supervisor‚Äù projects. Reduced Google Maps API costs by 35% by integrating LeafletJS, an open-source solution, and improved route generation and vendor tracking functionality by implementing scalable and reusable code. This ensured readability, maintainability, testing, and flexibility for clients to switch between tools. Utilized technologies such as JavaScript, React.js, Bootstrap, Vue.js, Vuetify, Node.js, Express, MongoDB, and Redis.
EXP3.DESC_2: Developed a module for unit registration and route history, achieving organized and accurate management, enhancing system functionality, and improving administration and monitoring by 40%. Implemented JavaScript, React.js and SASS on the client side and a RESTful API with Node.js, Express, and MongoDB on the server side.
EXP3.DESC_3: Developed the ‚ÄúQR Combos and QR Discounts‚Äù project to manage promotions, enabling user-vendor interaction through QR codes. Implemented features for promotion, client and logs management, QR code generation, and promotion visualization using JavaScript, Vue.js, Vuetify, and Git.
EXP3.DESC_4: Developed a module for unit responsibility management, allowing data administration and retrieval through the integration of a RESTful API with Node.js, Express, MongoDB, React.js, and SASS.
EXP3.DESC_5: Created the Landing Page for the ‚ÄúeOrdering‚Äù project, achieving a modern and mobile-optimized interface using JavaScript, React.js, and CSS.

EXP4.TITLE: FullStack Developer in educational solutions
EXP4.DESC_1: Designed and developed tools to optimize the management of grades and academic records using technologies such as TypeScript, React.js, Tailwind, .NET, Node.js, Prisma, MongoDB, and PostgreSQL.
EXP4.DESC_2: Automated the management of student lists and grades, optimizing administrative processes and improving data consistency by 60% using TypeScript, React.js, Tailwind, Node.js, and MongoDB.

EXP5.TITLE: Courses and Certifications
EXP5.DESC_1: Learning new tools for web development and exploring the latest features of other technologies to keep my skills updated and constantly improving.

PROJECTS.DELAY_DESC: It may take 1 minute to load for the first time since it was uploaded for free to Render.
PROJECTS.GEOGUIDE_DESC: Application for geolocation of places or points of interest based on terms provided by the user, with functionalities such as placing markers, drawing polygons on the map, viewing details of the specific location, and tracing routes. Implementing libraries such as Turf.js and Mapbox for the map, LottieFiles for animated images, and Sonner for on-screen notifications.
PROJECTS.CHAT_APP_DESC: Real-time FullStack application with functionality to handle multiple conversations. Making use of tools such as Socket IO, Web Sockets and Json Web Token for user authorization and authentication.
PROJECTS.E_TIANGUIS_DESC: Shopping cart functionality demo. Built from scratch using React with reducers, Context API for state management and animated notifications.
PROJECTS.EXPENSE_CONTROL_DESC: Application for simple expense management and organization. Developed in TypeScript and implementing Zustand and reducers for information flow and manipulation in React.
PROJECTS.CALENDAR_APP_DESC: Event and appointment scheduler with authentication and authorization levels for record modification. FullStack application implementing NodeJs, Express, MongoDB and Json Web Token for the correct functioning of the Backend, React, React Router and Bootstrap for the Frontend and Redux for the global state management.
PROJECTS.DASHBOARD_TEMPLATE_DESC: Responsive Dashboard Template. Using React and pure CSS.
PROJECTS.JAVASCRIPT_QUIZ_DESC: 10-question quiz about JavaScript. Coded in TypeScript and implementing Zustand for state management in React and Material UI for responsive design.
PROJECTS.JOURNAL_APP_DESC: Application for recording trips, moments and special events, with the ability to store photos, descriptions and dates. Developed with Firebase for data storage and login management with Google, Redux as a global state manager and Cloudinary to manage the application images in the cloud.
PROJECTS.RICK_AND_MORTY_APP_DESC: The classic Rick and Morty API consuming application but now with implementations such as: URL Params as state, skelenton loaders, lazy images, lazy load, dynamic filters, dynamic search, pagination and responsiveness.
PROJECTS.ROOM_GREENS_DESC: Designed in Tailwind and React. Landing Page for the sale of articles with scalable and reusable animations using Framer Motion.
PROJECTS.EVOKEEASE_DESC: Landing Page oriented to the promotion of events and concerts. Developed with Styled Components for the responsive design and Framer Motion for the on-screen element animations.
PROJECTS.YUMRUSH_DESC: Created in Tailwind and React. Landing Page with responsive design for a restaurant with home delivery service.
PROJECTS.STRATOCLOUD_DESC: Responsive Landing Page for selling services. Developed with React and Tailwind.

ABOUT.DESC_1: Hello! My name is Carlos Francisco L√≥pez Ju√°rez, but my friends call me Megas. I hold a degree in Computer Engineering, and I also completed studies in Social Sciences focused on teaching at the high school level and beyond. My first experience with programming was when I wanted to create my own website dedicated to news and reviews about video games‚ÄîI was 12 years old. Since then, I have focused and committed myself to this technological path, from creating video games on LED matrices with Arduino,
ABOUT.DESC_2: to working with teams at multinational companies on the development of web applications and solutions.
